name: Gather iron ingot
goal: Obtain iron ingots through smelting, crafting, mining, looting, or trading
notes: Iron ingots are one of the most important resources in Minecraft. They are used for tools, armor, shields, buckets, shears, anvils, and more. The Iron Tools Pipeline requires 41 iron ingots total (for all tools, armor, shield, bucket, and shears). The most common method is mining iron ore and smelting it, but there are MANY other ways to obtain iron ingots. Do NOT just look for 'iron_ingot' items on the ground — that is very unlikely. Instead, look for iron ORE to mine and smelt, or use one of the other methods below.

steps.title: Method 1: Mine iron ore and smelt it (MOST COMMON)
steps.details: Find iron ore blocks (stone with tan/beige specks) underground. Iron ore spawns at Y=-64 to Y=320 but is most common at Y=16 and Y=232. Deepslate iron ore is found below Y=0. Mine with a STONE PICKAXE or better — wooden pickaxes CANNOT mine iron ore. In Minecraft 1.17+, mining iron ore drops 'raw_iron' (not the ore block itself unless using Silk Touch). Smelt 1 raw_iron in a furnace with any fuel to get 1 iron_ingot. Coal/charcoal smelts 8 items each. A lava bucket smelts 100 items.
checks: Have a stone_pickaxe or better equipped
Look for iron_ore or deepslate_iron_ore in perception blocks
Have a furnace placed and fuel available

steps.title: Method 2: Break down iron blocks
steps.details: If you have an iron_block (or find one in a structure), craft it into 9 iron ingots. Place 1 iron_block in the crafting grid -> 9 iron_ingots. Iron blocks can be found in: woodland mansions, trial chambers, and villages (rarely). No crafting table needed — works in 2x2 grid.

steps.title: Method 3: Craft from iron nuggets
steps.details: 9 iron_nuggets crafted in a 3x3 grid = 1 iron_ingot. Iron nuggets drop from: zombies/husks/drowned (rarely), smelting iron tools/armor in a furnace, and as loot from various structures. This is inefficient but useful for recycling old iron gear. Requires a crafting table.
checks: Have at least 9 iron_nugget in inventory

steps.title: Method 4: Loot from chests
steps.details: Iron ingots appear in chests in many structures: villages (toolsmith, weaponsmith, armorer houses), dungeons, mineshafts, strongholds, temples (desert, jungle), shipwrecks, buried treasure, bastions, end cities, nether fortresses, and trial chambers. Shipwreck treasure chests and buried treasure are particularly good sources (1-5 ingots).
checks: Look for chest blocks in perception

steps.title: Method 5: Kill iron golems
steps.details: Iron golems drop 3-5 iron ingots on death. Found in villages (1 per 10 villagers + 21 beds) or can be built from 4 iron blocks + 1 carved pumpkin. WARNING: attacking a village's iron golem makes the entire village hostile. Only use this if the golem is from a hostile mob farm or you built it yourself.
checks: Iron golem visible in perception entities

steps.title: Method 6: Trade with villagers
steps.details: Armorer, toolsmith, and weaponsmith villagers sell iron-related items. Some villager trades indirectly provide iron tools or armor. You can also trade emeralds for iron tools. Not a direct iron ingot source but provides finished iron items.

steps.title: Method 7: Smelt iron gear for nuggets
steps.details: Smelting any iron tool, weapon, or armor piece in a furnace yields 1 iron_nugget. This is very inefficient (e.g., an iron chestplate that cost 8 ingots only returns 1 nugget) but can recycle damaged gear. 9 nuggets -> 1 ingot.
checks: Have unwanted iron tools/armor and a furnace
